Articles.Content:
The Ca-23 is my first serious attempt at building a fighter carrier. I built it in parallel with my just released Co-23 Corvette and so both ships share many design features with a focus on aesthetics rather than armour. Stripping almost all of the armour allowed me to add in many more minor features to improve the appearance and also provided a dV boost compared to most of my previous ships allowing trips as far as Laythe. Numerous hard points including a pair of Sr. docking ports allows it to function effectively as a mother ship and additional fuel can be mounted for long journeys. As per usual I mounted a very large engine block as well as a Skipper boost engine to give the ship surprising acceleration considering its sheers size while 10 reaction wheels mean that orbital manoeuvres don't take too long.

I have mounted both a linear bridge for controlling the ship while the lower mounted lander can is purely to enjoy the view and the ships should not be controlled from here. The ship should have SAS kept on as it is not perfectly balanced and will pitch slightly if left to its own devices.

I haven't included weaponry with this ship so people can either arm it with their own or simply use it as a civilian vessel instead.

Craft File: https://www.dropbox.com/s/nczrn6qr4x64tps/Ca-23A.craft

Hotkeys

1: Nerva Engines

2: Skipper

10: Toggle panels and antennae

Stats

Parts: 390

dV: 6700

TWR: 0.61

Mass: 230 Tons

Cost:330,000 Kerbits

Edited January 16, 2014 by Comrade Jenkens

That is the most awesome ship i've ever seen in my life!

It probably laggs really much.
Stop this at once. I can't handle your ships. They're too radiant and beautiful for my eyes. This is not allowed.

Wow.

I feel like this needs merely a few drop tanks and a fleet of probes, and then Jool is no match for your shipbuilding might!
